title: 111_s3746
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. INCENTIVES FOR INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGIES LOAN GUARANTEE PROGRAM." is about a program that provides incentives for innovative technologies through loan guarantees. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to specify conditions for making guarantees, including the requirement for an appropriation or payment from the borrower to cover the guarantee cost. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to specify conditions for making guarantees, including the requirement for an appropriation or payment from the borrower to cover the guarantee cost. The source of payments received from a borrower under certain paragraphs shall not be a loan or debt obligation guaranteed by the Federal Government. The Secretary may waive the requirement for a third-party credit report if project costs are not projected to exceed $100,000,000 and the applicant agrees to accept the credit rating assigned by the Secretary. Additionally, the Secretary is granted direct hire authority under certain conditions. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 allows the Executive Director of the loan guarantee program to recruit and appoint highly qualified personnel for critical positions in the competitive service, excluding positions in the excepted service or Senior Executive Service. The Director must ensure that candidates have specialized knowledge relevant to the program functions. The Executive Director must ensure actions are consistent with merit principles and public notice requirements. The authority provided shall end on September 30, 2011. The Secretary can retain professional advisors for loan guarantees and require applicants to cover fees. The Secretary can select advisors to protect US interests for eligible projects on multiple non-contiguous sites. Amendments allow for multiple applications for eligible projects. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include energy efficiency projects like retrofitting buildings. The Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 is amended to limit administrative costs for loans. The Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007 is amended to limit administrative costs for loans to $100,000 or 10 basis points of the loan. The Secretary may retain professional advisors for loan guarantees and require applicants to pay fees for their services. The Secretary may retain professional advisors for loan guarantees and require applicants to pay fees for their services to protect the interests of the United States and achieve the purposes of this section.
